Bought this when it came out for 10 bucks, put in over 125 hours. Totally worth it. Fucking awesome game.

Gameplay is camping heavy, movement is clunky, classes require a lot of grinding to level up. Playing with other people makes it a lot of fun, though, and there are a lot of good maps available. The british accents are great.

Une tuerie tout simplement !! Killing Floor c'est le fun a l'état pur, qu'est ce qu'il y a de mieux que d'exploser des zombies avec des dizaines d'armes sur fond de musique métal accompagnés de quelques potes en reseau ?? Une grosse durée de vie, une bonne communauté de joueurs, des graphismes plutôt sympa, une ambiance vraiment réussi... En fait Killing Floor enterre complétement Left For Dead, jeu auquel il est souvent comparé. Bref pour quelques euros sur steam c'est des dizaines d'heures de plaisir en perspective ^^ 16/20

It's a lot of fun. The monsters range from spidery to vicious to ruthless. The maps are also very detailed and atmospheric. Just be warned: it gets really difficult really fast. You depend a lot on your teammates for survival.

This game is awesome, really fun to play with friends, or even alone. One of the few horror game that really get you on your nerve, stress you out. But as fun as it is... It is way too hard. It's not so hard that it's not even fun to play, but it is so hard that it'll make you rage quit a couple times. Just from beginner to normal, there's a big difference. And while you have fun with 3-4 people, just wait a 5th and 6th one join, it get even harder, and if one of the 6 persons is a troll, you're all f... you're all doomed. But I still recommend this game, because it is really really alot of fun.
The best Co-Op Survival Horror game ever! Even my dog loves this game.
This game is really good if you playing horror games!

THIS.FUCKING.GAME.

It holds a special place in my gaming standards just as the original DOOM games do. It's never repetitive, it's gory, it's violent, it's got an amazing arsenal of weapons and just all round KICKS ASS.

Oh yeah, and it's really fucking under priced, in all fairness i would buy this game again for £40 if i had to because it's just that good a game. I highly recommend this game to all gamers unless your really squirmish about games of this nature. The soundtrack is one of the best i've ever heard, just pure raw metal blasting though your headphones to sounds of slow motion duel Handcannons tearing through the faces of the specimens in a highly explosive manner... glorious.

Do yourself a favor and buy this game already god damn it.

Killing floor is a very good game. There is single player, and multiplayer. Each wave you progress it gets harder each round. At the end of each round, you can go to the trader, which you can buy guns, melee weps, grenades, body armor. There are alot of pretty cool guns. There are several classes, and the higher class level, all the guns involved with that class will cost less, and do more damage. There are lots of customized maps with alot of nice add-ons and more. And if you use steam workshop, you can add on new maps, mutators, guns, weapons and stuff like dat. There is more that I'm not going to mention because it would take too dang long, but i recommend this game.
Good game
Dosh simulator. The game is good floor a lot of reasons, but you can only put so many hours into it.

Played for... a long time, with everything almost at level 6. It's replayable and fun, with a variety of weapons. It's a lot better if you get a bunch of friends together and organise yourself to do a different role. This game really is about cooperation and teamwork to win. Also, Russians suck at this game.

There will be comparisons to Left 4 Dead, but what it lacks in Valve's popular title, it has a few tricks of its own. Up to 6 players take on waves of mutants in open free roam environmentas, choosing and leveling up classes and buying increasingly more poweful weapons. Despite the one note gameplay, the sheer variety in maps, enemies and weapons more than makes up for what it lacks when compared to Left 4 Dead.

This is my most played game at the moment, and theres reason for that. 1) It's not graphic intensive. 2) works great on my virus ridden Toshiba Satellite. 3) Its loads of fun with friends. 4) Whats not to love about fighting hordes and hords of various enemy types? Yes it looks bad from the thumbnote, I too had my doubts, but I'm glad I was convinced to buy it.

I'm honest here: This is seriously one of the best Co-op games I have seen/played so far. Though your money and kills get resetted, your perk stays. Which means addiction in a full mass! I can't stop shooting/slicing/sniping/roasting/bombing through these specimens! And best thing, if you get bored, just raise the difficulty! There you can discuss your boredom with some enraged fleshpounds.

If you got spare cash and think "Hurr, I could use some goddamn Survival Action FPS!", this is the first one to go.

Money well spent I say.
it's awesome, just get it

I like this game a whole bunch.
its a well done game. Killing zombies with 5 other of your friends is a treat.

Great little game to boot up when you have 15 minutes to spare. Has a passive level progression, 7 non-fixed "classes", a large variety of weapons and skins, optional DLC weapons and skins (almost all purely cosmetic) and a medium-sized learning curve. Co-op involving teamchat (game has in-built) is highly recommended, due to the need to strategise on-the-go against a variety of zombies (called 'zeds').

Plus, let's face it. You can decapitate zombies in several interesting ways. Who's going to say no to that?
Im telling you now..If you want a zombie game get this one the best there is out there. Six people helping each other couldnt get any harder then it already is.
Co-op is key. The game runs quite fine and requires skills of precision and tactics to successfully eliminate the attacking zombies.

[h1]Gory, unforgiving, brutal. Killing Floor is the explosive result of a total conversion mod becoming one solid wave-survival game![/h1]

Killing Floor started as a mod for Unreal Tournament 2004 all the way back in 2005, and eventually became a full fledged game. It is as much of a straight-forward wave-survival coop game as any can be, but it's done well and that's what it matters, it doesn't try to reinvent the wheel, it just makes one damn good wheel.

London, England, 2009. A biotech company messed up big time and now mutated specimens are wrecking havoc in the British cities. You're part of a team sent to those locations to clean the mess. You have access to your arsenal of guns, allies, and your British cussing. Go blow some heads up in glorious slow motion. Sounds like a bloody blast, doesn't it mate? Oh, did I mention that the maps have metal tracks that play while you relish on the bloodshed? Enjoy the distorted riffs while you rip and tear.

There's two main game modes, the classic Killing Floor mode where you and a group of friends can fight hordes leading up to the boss, Patriarch, and an objective mode which you can complete tasks amidst the chaos in exchange for money. In both modes, you can buy new weapons and gear in-between waves of enemies. There are Perks (classes) each with its own exclusive weapons and abilities, and as you play you'll level them up and unlock new skills. One of the interesting things about Killing Floor is that there is no cross-hair, so must you aim well and truly and trust yourself; some nice kills will award a slow motion sequence which is rewarding on its own, but shooting the guns, exploding things, or just bashing skulls with a melee weapon all feel incredibly satisfying and impacting in this game. Try the crossbow, it'll shoot straight through multiple enemies, most fun when you headshot through 5  zeds for that domino effect.

The game features several different types of specimens (AKA zeds) each posing unique threats and making the team stay on their feet. You have the Husk, which can shoot fire from a distance, the Stalker which turns invisible, the Flesh Pound which runs fast and when pissed does massive damage, the tanky Scrake carrying a chainsaw to chop you up, etc. However, all the specimen have weak points too, such as getting stunned by certain guns and headshots (Sharpshooters can stun Scrakes for instance), or being weak to explosives. Level design is crafted so the team can keep on the run or bunker up somewhere and try to survive, you'll need good communication and awareness in the higher difficulties. You can reinforce doors up with a welding tool, you can heal allies with a medic gun or injection, you can give each other cash, etc. It's all about the team work and facing the odds while wreaking bloody havoc, or you can also try to go solo of course.

The developers supported Killing Floor for quite a while as well, about 4 years after release. You have access to a lot of content in the vanilla game, but there are packs for character skins (some feature exclusive voices) which are optional. Unfortunately, there are also some guns that are locked behind DLCs, and those guns are great for some of the perks, not essential, but really good. Still, the game itself features 7 Perks, over 10 maps to choose from, and you can customize the matches' length and difficulty to suit your needs, providing a great replay value. You also automatically download new community maps when you join them.

There are few things to keep in mind though, as this is an older low-budget title and a few elements haven't aged so well. There's no running in this game, only the default movement speed which is quite slow (you can go faster by switching to the knife), movement can be a tad clunky with heavy fall damage (sometimes, falling from a low rail will kill you), and the HUD isn't the most intuitive HUD out there (at times it's hard to notice how low your HP is). There's also a few annoying invisible walls per map. Killing Floor can also be very grindy if you're trying to level up your perks, as you need an absurd amount of matches to reach the kill milestones to level up each perk. The graphics weren't the best even at the time, and although all zeds are well designed (they definitely have the creepy and intimidating factor), some things still look pretty bad; hitboxes are also a tad wonky and one of the biggest issues, as sometimes headshots won't register and so on.

Regardless of its age showing and the game being simplistic, Killing Floor holds up to this day, and personally I consider it a better game than its sequel. Not only does it have more content to this day than the sequel, but also, it has better designed maps and a better Hell on Earth mode. Overall Killing Floor just accomplishes its goal as a coop horde-survival better than its successor.
A great team shooter.  Lots of upgrades, weapons, and maps.  DLC is a bit flooded but generally reasonably priced.  With a group of friends this game rules.  Playing alone its not as good.
Best zombie wave game on the internet.
Zombie defense. Augh yeah.
One of the best constantly updating fun times to be had well support by an active community
Killing zombies. What more could you ask for?

Waves upon waves of zeds, each with their own unique abilities, descend upon you and your friends in this co-op survival mod turned standalone game. Zombie and human being torn to shreds by bullet and claw is set to an all metal soundtrack. On its lowest difficulties the game is tough. At its highest you will find yourself dying more than just a few times as you hunt down the almighty Patriarch which I won't spoil for you. This game's replayability is found in its difficulty and the numerous perks and weapons you can arm yourself with. You can choose to go solo or join a server with up to 5 other players and pop zombie heads, dismember limbs and splatter bodies all over the floor and walls. Health and armor drops are rare during combat so make sure you stock up between waves if you want to survive. I highly reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys the co-op experience and annihilating zombies. Let me know if you want to play!

Best damn Linux shooter EVER! Multiple classes, waves and waves of mutants/zombies, and a plethora of weapons!  I like the attitude of the characters and the zones/maps are pretty damn good!  It does run well on Linux and is hands down my favorite "zombie" shooter of all time.  The action is intense, fast paced, team based, and usally lone wolf tactics result in serious bodily injury or death.  The beastiary is varied enough to make it a challenge and the final boss is a real badass.

Wer vom massenweise Zombies schlachten im Multiplayer nicht genug kriegt, seine Klassen leveln will und auf eine riesen Waffenauswahl steht, bitte.
